alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lafayette; Lee; Pontotoc (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:53AM CDT until April 01 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Lafayette County in northwestern Mississippi... Northeastern Calhoun County in northeastern Mississippi... Pontotoc County in northeastern Mississippi... Lee County in northeastern Mississippi... * Until 145 AM CDT. * At 1252 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Randolph, or 12 miles west of Pontotoc, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Tupelo, Pontotoc, Verona, Trace State Park, Tombigbee State Park, Saltillo, Shannon, Plantersville, Ecru, Randolph, Troy, Furrs, Nettleton, Sherman, Thaxton, Algoma, Toccopola, Robbs, Endville and Cherry Creek. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi.
